verses.verse: My soul <WH5315> is weary <WH5354> of my life <WH2416>; I will leave <WH5800> my complaint <WH7879> upon myself <WH1696>; I will speak in the bitterness <WH4751> of my soul <WH5315>.
I will say <WH559> unto God <WH433>, Do not condemn <WH7561> me <WH3045>; show me why you contend with me <WH7378>.

Is it good <WH2895> unto you that you should oppress <WH6231>, that you should despise <WH3988> the work <WH3018> of your hands <WH3709>, and shine <WH3313> upon the counsel <WH6098> of the wicked <WH7563>?
Have you eyes <WH5869> of flesh <WH1320>? or see <WH7200> you as man <WH582> sees <WH7200>?
Are your days <WH3117> as the days <WH3117> of man <WH582>? are your years <WH8141> as man <WH1397>'s days <WH3117>,
That you inquire <WH1245> after my iniquity <WH5771>, and search <WH1875> after my sin <WH2403>?
You know <WH1847> that I am not wicked <WH7561>; and there is none that can deliver <WH5337> out of your hand <WH3027>.
Your hands <WH3027> have made <WH6087> me and fashioned <WH6213> me together <WH3162> round about <WH5439>; yet you do destroy me <WH1104>.
Remember <WH2142>, I beg you <WH6213>, that you have made me as the clay <WH2563>; and will you bring <WH7725> me into dust <WH6083> again <WH7725>?
Have you not poured me out <WH5413> as milk <WH2461>, and curdled <WH7087> me like cheese <WH1385>?
You have clothed <WH3847> me with skin <WH5785> and flesh <WH1320>, and have fenced <WH7753> me with bones <WH6106> and sinews <WH1517>.
You have granted <WH6213> me life <WH2416> and favor <WH2617>, and your visitation <WH6486> has preserved <WH8104> my spirit <WH7307>.
And these things have you hid <WH6845> in your heart <WH3824>: I know that this is with you <WH3045>.
If I sin <WH2398>, then you mark <WH8104> me <WH5352>, and you will not acquit me from my iniquity <WH5771>.

If I be wicked <WH7561>, woe <WH480> unto me <WH6663>; and if I be righteous, yet will I not lift up <WH5375> my head <WH7218>. I am full <WH7649> of confusion <WH7036>; therefore see <WH7202> you my affliction <WH6040>;
For it increases <WH1342>. You hunt <WH6679> me as a fierce lion <WH7826>: and again <WH7725> you show yourself marvelous upon me <WH6381>.
You renew <WH2318> your witnesses <WH5707> against me <WH7235>, and increase your indignation <WH3708> upon me <WH5978>; changes <WH2487> and war are against me <WH6635>.
Therefore then have you brought me forth <WH3318> out of the womb <WH7358>? Oh that I had given up the Spirit <WH1478>, and no eye <WH5869> had seen me <WH7200>!
I should have been as though I had not been <WH2986>; I should have been carried from the womb <WH990> to the grave <WH6913>.
Are not my days <WH3117> few <WH4592>? cease <WH2308> then <WH7896>, and let me alone, that I may take comfort <WH1082> a little <WH4592>,
Before I go <WH3212> from where I shall not return <WH7725>, even to the land <WH776> of darkness <WH2822> and the shadow of death <WH6757>;
A land <WH776> of darkness <WH5890>, as darkness <WH652> itself <WH6757>; and of the shadow of death, without any order <WH5468>, and where the light <WH3313> is as darkness <WH652>.
